description: ERECTION OF REAR WRAP AROUND GROUND FLOOR EXTENSION, FIRST FLOOR REAR EXTENSION AND LOFT REAR DORMER ROOF EXTENSION, AND ERECTION OF REAR EXTERNAL ROOF TERRACE, TO EXISTING TWO FLATS
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: SV/100 (Ordinance Survey & Block Plan); SV/101 (Existing Site Plan); SV/102 (Existing Ground Floor Plan); SV/103 (Existing First Floor Plan); SV/104 (Existing Roof Plan); SV/105 (Existing Front Elevation); SV/106 (Existing Rear Elevation); SV/107 (Existing Side Elevation & Section); PA/200 A (Site Plan); PA/202 A (First Floor Plan); PA/203 A (Loft Plan); PA/204 A (Roof Plan); PA/205 A; PA/206 A (Side Elevation & Section from 59); PA/207 A (Rear Elevation); PA/208 A (Side Elevation from 61); Design and Access Statement: at design Flat A & B, 60 Alexandra Road, Wimbledon, London, SW19 7LB 28.02.2020

Condition : 3 - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - The screening or enclosure to the balcony as shown on the approved plans shall be implemented before the development is first occupied and retained permanently thereafter. The screening shall be obscurely glazed and shall be set at a height of no less than 1.7 m when measured from finsihsed external terrace floor level.

Condition : 5 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the window at first floor level in the side elevation shall be glazed with obscured glass and shall be maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 6 - No demolition or construction work or ancillary activities such as deliveries shall take place before 8am or after 6pm Mondays - Fridays inclusive, before 8am or after 1pm on Saturdays or at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Condition : 7 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The application was approved without delay.
